meaning: (of a state, quality, or emotion) very great or intense.
(of a person or statement) having or showing great knowledge or insight.
the deepest part of something, especially the ocean.
(of a law or rule) forbidding or restricting something.
(of a price or charge) so high as to prevent something being done or bought.
increase rapidly in number; multiply.
an inclination or natural tendency to behave in a particular way.
win or regain the favour of (a god, spirit, or person) by doing something that pleases them.
conformity to conventionally accepted standards of behaviour or morals.
forbid, especially by law.
having a sharply strong taste or smell.
officially recognized as being trained to perform a particular job; certified.
not complete or absolute; limited.
be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition.
become officially recognized as a practitioner of a particular profession or activity, typically by undertaking a course and passing examinations.
make (a statement or assertion) less absolute; add reservations to.
a slight objection or criticism.
in a state or period of inactivity or dormancy.
(of air, especially that at high altitudes) of lower pressure than usual; thin.
distant from the lives and concerns of ordinary people; esoteric.
make or become less dense or solid.
having an obstinately uncooperative attitude towards authority or discipline.
say that one no longer holds an opinion or belief, especially one considered heretical.
favouring a solitary life.
a person who lives a solitary life and tends to avoid other people.
(of a subject or knowledge) little known; abstruse.
stubborn or unmanageable.
resistant to a process or stimulus.
prove (a statement or theory) to be wrong or false; disprove.
example: profound feelings of disquiet
a profound philosopher
nor billowy surge disturbs the vast profound
prohibitive legislation
the cost of converting existing power stations is likely to be prohibitive
the science fiction magazines which proliferated in the 1920s
his propensity for violence
the pagans thought it was important to propitiate the gods with sacrifices
he always behaved with the utmost propriety
strikes remained proscribed in the armed forces
the pungent smell of frying onions
newly qualified nurses
I could only judge this CD a qualified success
a pensioner who does not qualify for income support
the training necessary to qualify as a solicitor
she felt obliged to qualify her first short answer
the only quibble about this book is the price
strikes were headed by groups of workers who had previously been quiescent
every ounce carried counts triple when you're trudging uphill in rarefied air
rarefied scholarly pursuits
air rarefies and degrounds the physical body
a class of recalcitrant fifteen-year-olds
heretics were burned if they would not recant
she has turned into a virtual recluse
the book is full of recondite information
his refractory pony
some granules are refractory to secretory stimuli
these claims have not been convincingly refuted
